issues.title: Heading elements are not in a sequentially-descending order
issues.description: Properly ordered headings that do not skip levels convey the semantic structure of the page, making it easier to navigate and understand when using assistive technologies. [Learn more about heading order](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/heading-order).

issues.title: <li> elements must be contained in a <ul> or <ol>
issues.description: Ensure <li> elements are used semantically

any.message: List item does not have a <ul>, <ol> parent element

nodes.html: • Blog Archive
nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  List item does not have a <ul>, <ol> parent element

issues.title: List items (`<li>`) are not contained within `<ul>`, `<ol>` or `<menu>` parent elements.
issues.description: Screen readers require list items (`<li>`) to be contained within a parent `<ul>`, `<ol>` or `<menu>` to be announced properly. [Learn more about proper list structure](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/listitem).
